body:
Interesting!!! the same code, I commit it, Travis CI tested failed, I reset and recommit without modifying one letter, and it builds pass. see [previous build](https://travis-ci.org/pytorch/pytorch/builds/217478648) and  [latter build](https://travis-ci.org/pytorch/pytorch/builds/217481439)
```
FAIL: test_half_tensor (__main__.TestTorch)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_torch.py", line 2653, in test_half_tensor
    self.assertEqual(x.half().float(), x, 1e-3)
  File "/home/travis/build/pytorch/pytorch/test/common.py", line 132, in assertEqual
    assertTensorsEqual(x, y)
  File "/home/travis/build/pytorch/pytorch/test/common.py", line 126, in assertTensorsEqual
    self.assertLessEqual(max_err, prec, message)
AssertionError: 0.0018029212951660156 not less than or equal to 0.001 : 
----------------------------------------------------------------------

FAILED (failures=1, skipped=23)
```
